references.reason: This paper lays the theoretical foundation for reverse-time diffusion models, which are the basis for score-based generative models used extensively in this work.

references.paper_title: Diffusion models beat gans on image synthesis
references.reason: This highly influential paper demonstrated the superiority of diffusion models over GANs in image generation, significantly advancing the field and inspiring the use of diffusion models in other domains.
This foundational paper introduced denoising diffusion probabilistic models (DDPMs), providing a key framework and algorithm for training score-based generative models.

references.paper_title: Equivariant diffusion for molecule generation in 3d
references.reason: This paper made significant contributions to the specific application of diffusion models to 3D molecule generation, directly relevant to the present work's focus on graph generation.

references.paper_title: Score-based generative modeling of graphs via the system of stochastic differential equations
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant due to its focus on score-based generative modeling of graphs, which is the specific problem being addressed in this work.
